summary: nasopharyngeal swab samples positive for respiratory viruses were retrieved and thawed. LC/Q-TOF primary component analysis allowed preliminary identification of key metabolites that distinguished all virus-positive specimens. the negative group, and differentiated respiratory viruses from one another, including between influenza A 2009 H1N1 and H3N2 subtypes. this approach has substantial potential for diagnostic applications in infectious diseases directly from patient samples.
